event.title: Homecoming 2008 - Family/Community Day
event.shortdesc: Come and celebrate with us! Featuring numerous activities, including the Millersville Community Parade, various luncheons, reunions and just plain fun.

fulldesc.p: Come celebrate with us! Featuring numerous activities, including the Millersville Community Parade, various luncheons, reunions and just plain fun.
Click here for a complete list of events and activities.
For more information, please vist www.villealumni.com.
Take a break and stop in for a cup of fresh brewed coffee and breakfast items.

event.title: University Store Homecoming Sale
event.shortdesc: University Store Homecoming Ssale - 15% discount (see details)

fulldesc.p: 15% discount on all Millersville University insignia items and apparel.
Call 717-872-3268 or visit the store's homepage at http://www.studentservicesinc.com/

Take your chances with the treasure chest to win prizes. Lunch tickets will be available at lunch registration. Alumni pre-purchased football tickets will be held at the stadium. Hospitality continues at Biemesderfer Stadium in the afternoon. This event is free and open to the public.
Check in and receive information on the weekend events as well as special information for family members. There will be special traffic delays due to the parade.

event.title: Millersville Community Parade, "Animals:Fictional or Real"
event.shortdesc: Millersville Community Parade, "Animals: Fictional or Real"

fulldesc.p: Bands, floats, twirlers, Millersville University's Skully, marchers, civic groups, fire engines and so much more. Be a part of it or watch the award-winning, annual community and University effort as the two-mile parade winds through the Borough of Millersville, ending at the Student Memorial Center. Parade Grand Marshals for this year areÂ Judy and Ralph Anttonen.
One of Lancaster County's largest parades! For more information, call the Parade Hotline at 717-871-2213 or visit www.parade.millersville.edu

NOTE: George St., Herr Ave. and Landis Ave. will close at 8:45 a.m. for the parade; alternate routes will be posted on November 1. Parade will run approximately 2.5 to 3 hours. Please allow ample time to reach your destination.

event.location: Millersville - N. George Street, Herr Ave., Landis Ave.

event.title: Millersville University Athletic Chicken BBQ
event.shortdesc: On Saturday November 1, 2008, the Millersville University Athletic Department will host a freshly prepared chicken BBQ lunch. The lunch begins at 10:00 a.m. and will last until 1:00 p.m.

fulldesc.p: The cost is $8 for dinner and $5 for half. The proceeds will benefit Marauder Athletics. Preordering is suggested and guarantees meal availability. Dinner includes chicken, chips, roll/butter, applesauce, dessert and a pint beverage.
The deadline to order tickets is Friday, October 24, 2008. To order tickets, please contact Donna at 717-872-3405 or email deshleman@millersville.edu.
On November 1, 2008 after the Millersville University Community Parade and before the game, guests are invited to Gordinier for a hot buffet lunch with alumni and parade friends.

This luncheon is sponsored by the Millersville University Alumni Association, and is $13 per ticket. Reservations are required. Lunch will begin at 11:30 a.m. For more information, please contact Diane O'Connor, Alumni Services, at diane.oconnor@millersville.edu.

event.title: Lunch in the Dining Hall
event.shortdesc: Millersville University offers the dining services of the Upper Deck in Gordinier Hall during Homecoming, Fall Fling and Community Day festivities, which are all rolled into one day this year.

fulldesc.p: On November 1, 2008, during Homecoming, Fall Fling and Community Day festivities, Millersville University invites students, parents and family to dine in Gordinier Dining Hall. Lunch is buffet-style, and $7.75 for adults. No tickets or reservations are required. For more information, please contact Diane O'Connor, Alumni Services, atdiane.oconnor@millersville.edu.

event.title: School of Education Open House
event.shortdesc: On Saturday, November 1, 2008, Millersville University of Pennsylvania is hosting a School of Education Open House between 11:30 a.m. and noon.

fulldesc.p: Located in a yellow and white tent on the Gerhart, Osburn and Byerly lawn, all alumni are invited to attend a special tent reception with light lunch fare. Come home to find out what is happening in the School of Education Millersville's largest school of alumni.

The dean of the School of Education, Dr. Jane Bray, and education faculty will all be attending. For information and to make reservations, please contact the Alumni Services Office by October 17, 2008. Reservations are requested and this event is free. For more information, contact Diane O'Connor, Alumni Services, at 717-871-5626.

event.title: School of Humanities and Social Sciences Drop-In and Open House
event.shortdesc: On November 1, 2008, Millersville University of Pennsylvania is having a Drop-In and Open House for the School of Humanities and Social Sciences.

fulldesc.p: Alumni are invited to come home and visit the home of the art department. Learn about recent happenings in the school, view the exhibition in Sykes Gallery, see example of student research projects and student art work and learn about the upcoming construction of the new Visual and Performing Arts Education Center. A light Lunch will be served.
Reservations are requested and this event is free. For reservations, contact the Alumni Services Office by October 17, 2008 at 717-871-5626.

event.title: United Campus Ministry Alumni Luncheon
event.shortdesc: On November 1, 2008 at Millersville University, the United Campus Ministry is hosting a luncheon for Alumni. From 11:30 a.m. 1:30 p.m., which will be in honor of Dr. Robert Sayre.

fulldesc.p: There will be a time of sharing for all friends of Dr. Sayre starting at11:30, and immediately following the rememberance there will be a luncheon until1:30 p.m.The luncheon is free for all United Campus Ministry (UCM) Alumni, family and friends. To make lunch reservations or for more information, please call the UCM office at 717-872-3355 or email Darrell.Woomer@millersville.edu.

event.title: Wrestling Reunion Luncheon

fulldesc.p: On November 1, 2008, former wrestlers, families and paremts are invited to join the current wrestling team. Anyone interested can then attend the football game. Reservations are required. Tickets are $13, and the luncheon will begin at 11:30 a.m. For more information, please contact Diane O'Connor, Alumni Services, at diane.oconnor@millersville.edu.

event.location: University Room, Gordinier Hall, Bolger Conference Center

event.title: Alumni Hospitality
event.shortdesc: Join in on the fun and games on November 1, 2008 at Millersville University of Pennsylvania. Register and spin the prize wheel to win Millersville University souvenirs beginning at 12:00 p.m. at the Marauder's Cove Alumni Tent in Beimesderfer Stadium on Chryst Field.

fulldesc.p: Join in on the fun and games on November 1, 2008 at Millersville University of Pennsylvania. Register and spin the prize wheel to win Millersville University souvenirs beginning at 12:00 p.m. at the Marauder's Cove Alumni Tent in Beimesderfer Stadium on Chryst Field.

Many business partners will be on hand as well, along with entertainment for the kids. Stick around in the tent after the game for hot soup at the fifth quarter party. This event is free. For more information, please contact Dianne O'Connor, Alumni Services, 717-871-5626.

event.title: MAK Men, Sigma Pi and Sigma Epsilon Beta Reunion Picnic
event.shortdesc: On November 1, 2008, all MAK Men, Sigma Pi and Sigma Epsilon Beta, their families and friends are invited to attend a reunion picnic.

fulldesc.p: Beginning at 12:00 p.m. and taking place in the tent by the visitors stand in Biemesderfer Stadium at Chryst Field, the members and their families are invited to relive campus days, watch the Marauders take on East Stroudsburg, hang out in the tent with friends, and snack on favorite football munchies.

The Cost includes ticket to the football game, and is $18 with reservations required. This event is sponsored by the Independent Financial Solutions and Carl Borst. For reservations, please contact Dianne O'Connor, alumni services, at 717-871-5626.

event.title: Science and Mathematics Alumni Luncheon
event.shortdesc: School of Science and Mathematics alumni are cordially invited to this luncheon in the Steinman Courtyard, Caputo Hall.

fulldesc.p: School of Science and Mathematics alumni are cordially invited to this luncheon in the Steinman Courtyard, Caputo Hall.
This event is free; however, reservations are encouraged. Reservations are due by October 17, 2008. For reservations or more information, contact the Alumni Services office at 717-871-5626.

event.title: Marauder Football vs. East Stroudsburg
event.shortdesc: On November 1, 2008, join Millersville University of Pennsylvania as it celebrates Homecoming in the football game against East Stroudsburg.

fulldesc.p: Marauder fans of all ages are welcome to attend this exciting event. Activities include Take a Kid to the Game Day, Hall of Fame inductions and presentations honoring seniors and distinguished service alumnus Dr. Gary Miller. Watch for specially priced $0.75 items at concession stands to mark our Homecoming Anniversary. Alumni and parents receive a $1 discount on game tickets.

Tickets are required for admission to the game. Advanced tickets for parents must be purchased by phone at 717-872-3811. Game tickets will be available for pick up at the "Will Call" box at the stadium.

event.title: Lecture and Book Signing
event.shortdesc: On November 1, 2008 Mr. Tom Baker will share highlights from his new book.

fulldesc.p: Alumnus Mr. Tom Baker '02 will lecture on his book, Get Involved!: Making the Most of Your 20's and 30's.
Please attend if you are interested in enhancing you leadership potential, expanding you professional network or extending your volunteer experiences.
This event is free; however, reservations are encouraged.

event.location: Matisse Room, Gordiner, Bolger Conference Center

event.title: "Its all Greek to Me" reunion
event.shortdesc: Alumni reunion for every Greek organization at Milelrsville

fulldesc.p: On November 1, 2008, alumni representing every Greek organization at Millersville will attend a reunion.
Memorabilia will be abound, and food and drink will be plentiful. Alumni are invited to come back and visit with their sisters and brothers for this momentous reunion.
Registration is required, and tickets are $25. The reunion is from 4:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m.

event.title: "Kung Fu Panda"
event.shortdesc: There will be three showings of "Kung Fu Panda" in the Club de 'Ville at the Student Memorial Center at 4:00, 7:00 and 11:00 p.m.

fulldesc.p: There will be three showings of "Kung Fu Panda" in the Club de 'Ville at the StudentMemorialCenter at 4:00, 7:00 and 11:00 p.m. This event is free and no tickets are required. The film is rated "PG."
Bring the whole family out and enjoy "Kung Fu Panda" befor it comes out on DVD.

event.title: The Fifth Quarter Party
event.shortdesc: On November 1, 2008, everyone is invited after the game for a community/alumni social.

fulldesc.p: On November 1, 2008, everyone is invitied after the game for a community/alumni social.

Located at the Marauder's Cove Alumni Tent at Biemesderfer Stadium, the Fifth Quarter Party will consist of the music of student band sensation Shefftet. Corn chowder will be served as well, sponsored by the Millersville University Alumni Association and Millersville University. This event is free. For more information, please contact Dianne O'Connor at 717-871-5626 or dianne.oconnor@millersville.edu.

event.location: Marauder's Cove Alumni Tent at Biemesderfer Stadium

event.shortdesc: Millersville University Greek organizations Lambda Chi Alpha and Delta Tau Zeta are having a pig roast picnic for alumni, family and kids of all ages.

fulldesc.p: On November 1, Millersville University's Greek organizations Lambda Chi Alpha and Delta Tau Zeta are having a pig roast picnic for alumni, family and kids of all ages.
Registration is required. Tickets are $20 for people 12 years and older, and kids under 12 can come for free.
This event will take place at Freedom Memorial Park, in Millersville PA at 4:30 p.m.

event.shortdesc: Roller hockey alumni reception and reunion

fulldesc.p: Millersville University and Brian (Snake) Dow, #99, invite all roller hockey alumni back to campus for an evening reception and reunion on Saturday, November 1, 2008.

Tickets are $30 per person and the event will take place at the Campus Grill in Gordinier Hall at the Bolger Conference Center at 5:30 p.m. The class of 1963 notes that if you did not receive your mailed invitation for this event, please call the alumni services office at 717-872-3352.

fulldesc.p: Meredith Grimsley is assistant professor of mixed media at Bloomsburg University.

Her work explores a very personal journey and examines the notion of "personal faith and communication while omitting actual text within the work." Her work is confronting her parallel questioning and celebration of her spiritual practices. It involves the combination of women's handwork techniques with painting and sculptural language into very tactile works.

event.title: Film: Rain in a Dry Land
event.shortdesc: Film: Rain in a Dry Land
event.fulldesc:
FALL FILM SERIES: Human Rights and Moral Wrongs
Rain in a Dry Land
"How do you measure the distance from an African village to an American city? What does it mean to be a refugee in today's 'global village'? 'Rain in a Dry Land' provides eye-opening answers as it chronicles the fortunes of two Somali Bantu families transported by relief agencies from years of civil war and refugee life to Atlanta, Georgia, and Springfield, Massachusetts.âÂ (Source: http://www.pbs.org/pov/pov2007/raininadryland/ )

event.title: Undergraduate Admissions Open House
event.shortdesc: Undergraduate admissions open house for prospective students.

fulldesc.p: Prospective students and their families are invited to a fall open house. Topics covered include admissions information, student life, programs of study and financial aid. Campus tours and faculty conferences are also available.Lunch will be available on campus and may be purchased for a nominal fee.
The program will begin at 8:30 a.m. on the Millersville campus.Tour guides will direct visitors to the starting location.
For more information and to register, visit the MU web site at www.millersville.edu or contact the Admissions Office at 1-877-XPLOR MU or (717) 872-3371.

event.title: 'Ville Idol: The Finale
event.shortdesc: The finale of the three-round singing competition of MU students and alumni. Today's featured music: songs from the 1980s, 1990s or current day hits. Tickets required for admission.

fulldesc.p: The finale of the three-round competition of MU students and alumni. Today's featured music: songs from the 1980s, 1990s or current day hits. The top finalist will be named at the end of the program and features two top prizes, in each category (alumni and student): $1000 and $250. Special entertainment will also be included in this afternoon's program. Host. Lori Burkholder '89. Special guest judges will also be on hand. Final scoring to come from the judges and the audience. Ticket required: $8 per person (children under 6 free). This contest is sponsored by the MU Alumni Association. Tickets: Student Memorial Center, Ticket Window, MU, 1 S. George Street, Millersville, weekdays, 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. or by calling 717-872-3811.

event.title: Film: Returned: Child Soldiers of Nepal’s Maoist Army
event.shortdesc: Film: "Child Soldiers in Sierra Leone" and U.N. Speaker

fulldesc.h4: Children at War: A Cinematic Review and Speaker from the United Nations Child Soldiers in Sierra Leone
fulldesc.p: "In 'Child Soldiers in Sierra Leone' - actor Michael Douglas hosts a sobering look at exploited children in this war-torn country where diamonds are traded for weapons.â "'I don't know how old I am,' said Abu Bakar Bangura, a slight and serious young boy from the West African country of Sierra Leone. 'I was very young when I was taken from my family,' he explained. Abu, as he is known, is one of the 10,000 children who were abducted from their homes and forced to become soldiers by both the pro-government and the rebel forces during the 10-year civil war that tore his country apart.Â An estimated 300,000 children like Abu have been kidnapped or conscripted to fight as a child soldiers in wars around the world. In some ways, they are the lucky ones. They survived.â ( Source: https://unp.un.org/details.aspx?pid=10609 and http://www.un.org/works/goingon/soldiers/abu_story.html )
This film complements this year's common reading, A Long Way Gone, Memoirs of a Boy Soldier by Ishmael Beah.
Free and Open to the Public.Â
Sponsors: Frederick Douglass Black Culture Celebration, University Theme, Humanities Film Festival and Common Reading.

event.location: Reighard Multipurpose Room, Student Memorial Center

event.shortdesc: A part of Millersville Univeristy and Franklin and Marshall College Fall Mathematics Colloquium.

p.strong: As a part of the fall mathematics colloquium,
Dr. Jana Iyengar, Franklin and Marshall
will speak. Topic to be announced.
For more information, please contact Dr. R. Kit Kittappa, Mathematics, at

event.location: 219 Stager Hall, Franklin and Marshall College

fulldesc.p: On November 22 and 23, 2008, West Coast studio artist and metalsmith Susan Kingsley will conduct a metals workshop at Millersville University of Pennsylvania titled, "Dynamic Die-Forming.â

Those who attend will learn about the die forming processes and techniques, and what can be done with a hydraulic press. The instructor will teach how to use basic metal forming tools and accessories in the press.

There will also be an open house on Friday, November 21 hosted by the Millersville University Metals Department from 4 p.m. until 7 p.m., when visitors can check out the new Dakota Bulldog Hydraulic Die Forming Presses that will be used in the workshop the following days.

Kingsley is the author of, "Hydraulic Die Forming for Jewelers and Metalsmiths.â Her work has been exhibited and published widely and is in several museum collections. She teaches part-time at Monterey Peninsula College and lectures in workshops throughout the United States and Canada. Kingsley is also the co-founder of Ethical Metalsmiths; a nonprofit organization that promotes the use of ethically mined and processed materials in the crafting of jewelry.

The workshop fee for members of the Pennsylvania Guild of Craftsmen is $155 and $167 for nonmembers. This two-day workshop runs from 10:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. To register, call 717-431-8706. For additional information, contact Christina Miller at Christina.miller@millersville.edu or view the Pennsylvania Guild of Craftsmen website at www.pacrafts.org/workshops.
Â
